results.title: Why Not the Kids?
results.creator_credit: Chelsea Productions and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Changes…From the Inside”.
Devised by Glenn and Les Mack for the Supplementary Grants Program of Victoria and shows how children can participate in school organisation. Children at a Victorian Primary School formed a committee and applied for and were granted a Supplementary Grant. The children suggested changes in school facilities, organisation and even curricula. In doing so, some of changes that occured challenged teachers’ perceptions of students and caused them to reappraise their role in the school community.

results.title: Closing the Gap
results.creator_credit: Glenn Mack, Les Mack and Chelsea Studios for the Education Department of Victoria
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Changes…From the Inside”.
Devised by Glenn and Les Mack for the Supplementary Grants Program of Victoria. Raises issues of concern for those attempting to bridge the gap between schools and the local community. Depicts the first tentative steps of a small inner-city secondary school.
Filmed at the historic, heritage registered building on City Road, Southbank, formerly the J.H. Boyd Girls’ High School, now (2017) known as the ‘Boyd Community Hub’.

results.title: Artisans of Australia
results.creator_credit: Paul Humfress, Pamela Paddon and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A four part tape that features master stonemason George Proudmen, moulder Jack Thomas, stained glass artist Kevin Little and axemen Bill Boyd and Mark Gardner at work during conservation and restoration work on National Estate places such as Coolamine Homestead, Garrison Holy Trinity Church and the Sydney Technical College at Ultimo.

results.title: Punching keys
results.creator_credit: Sally Ingleton and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: A biting dramatisation of the effects of the new technology in deskilling the female office workforce, alienating women from the products of their labour, and rendering them replaceable by cheaper labour overseas. Cast includes a young Gina Riley.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sally Ingleton and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School

results.title: The Melbourne Concert Hall
results.creator_credit: David Greig, David Morgan, The Victorian Arts Centre and Kestrel Films (Australia)
results.brief_description: Interviews with architects, administrators, interior designers, construction workers and others associated with the construction of the Melbourne Concert Hall. Artists who have performed at the venue also give their opinion of hall. Those interviewed include: Roy Ground, Neil Haysom, Theodore Schultz, Ken Myer, John Truscott and Kenny Christophers. Shows segments from performances by Jackie Love, Cleo Laine, Sylvio Gualdo, Karen Knowles, London Early Music Group, Mondo Rock, the guitarist John Williams, Brian May’s Melbourne Showband and conductors Piero Gamba, Patrick Thomas and John Hopkins. Views of Melbourne’s skyline capture the Gas and Fuel buildings that were demolished to accommodate Federation Square.

results.title: Kanga Cricket
results.brief_description: An Australian Cricket Board primary development programme for kids, sponsored by the Australian Diary Corporation and supported by the Commonwealth Department of Sport, Recreation and Tourism. Demonstrates the concept of Kanga cricket, a simplified adaptation of traditional cricket rules introduced into Australian schools. Former Australian cricket captain Kim Hughes and Peter Russell-Clarke participate.

results.title: Aussie assault
results.creator_credit: Harvey Spencer, Bill Scholer, Garry Holt and Sportmaster Programs
results.brief_description: A behind-the-scenes look at the work and preparation that went into Australia II winning entry in the America’s Cup. Shows the crew at leisure as well as at work.

results.title: Seeds of change
results.creator_credit: Diane O'Connor and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Examines changes in Victorian farm life documenting its evolution from horse to tractor to modern machinery. Filmed on location at Jeparit, this program uses period re-creation and documentary footage.

results.title: Not only to save our jobs
results.brief_description: Shows how a group of people at a small Melbourne manufacturing company acted to overcome the threat of losing their jobs by setting up a new form of organisation based on worker participation in ownership and decision-making. The effects on employees’ attitudes and work relationships are shown.
